Description: Fragment of neck and flattened handle of a Rhodian pottery transport amphora. Clay fine pink-brown; cream slip. Diamond stamp with ram's head symbol.
Production date: 148 BC (see N. Badoud, Le temps de Rhodes, 2015, 142.)
Curator's comments: Name Pythogenes. From same die as Alexandria, Greco-Roman Museum, MGR 1127.33.
Bibliographic references: Stoddart 1847 / Memoir on the inscribed pottery of Rhodes, Cnidus and other Greek Cities (233)
